bill_title: allow certain nonresidents to participate in school district elections.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow certain nonresidents to participate in school district elections. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-7 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A parent who is a nonresident of a school district may vote in the nonresident school district election or may be a candidate for elective school board membership if the parent has two or more children who reside in the parent's household and the children attend the nonresident school district. If the parent chooses to vote or be a candidate in the nonresident school district election, the parent shall comply with the requirements of § 13-7-4.2 or 13-7-6 not relating to residency and may not vote or be a candidate in any other school district election. The parent shall notify in writing the county auditor that supervises the school board elections of the parent's nonresident school district and the county auditor that supervises the parent's resident school district elections of the parent's intent to vote or be a candidate in the parent's nonresident school district election. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
